intro: Orophea desmos, commonly known as the Madagascar star tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant has compound leaves with a serrated margin and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Orophea desmos is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important component of the region's biodiversity.
